items.title: Inflation hotter than forecast at end of 2025, adding to rate hike expectations
items.description: Inflation rose at the end of 2025, picking up more than forecast. The Consumer Price Index rose 3.8 per cent annually in December, up from 3.4 per cent in the year to November, adding to rate hike expectations.

items.title: Tony Abbott intervenes in Liberal leadership battle
items.description: Former prime minister Tony Abbott has intervened in the Liberal leadership race, urging conservatives to unite behind either Angus Taylor or Andrew Hastie in their bid to oust Sussan Ley from the top job.

items.title: Live: David Littleproud defends record as surprise challenger emerges
items.description: David Littleproud has defended his record as Nationals leader after Colin Boyce flagged his plans to spill the leadership when parliament returns next week. Follow live.

items.title: Live: NSW towns bake in 'breathtaking' heat
items.description: Towns in New South Wales and Queensland are sweltering today amid a record-breaking heatwave, as firefighters continue to battle multiple blazes in Victoria. Follow live.

items.title: Live: Pegula with one foot in Australian Open semifinals after dominant first set
items.description: Novak Djokovic and Jannik Sinner are among the big names in action on day 11 at the Australian Open as we fast approach the business end of the tournament. Follow the action in our live blog.

items.title: 'Patience is at an end': Minnesota judge orders ICE head to face court
items.description: A Minnesota judge takes the extraordinary step of ordering the acting director of Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) to appear in person and explain why his agency keeps ignoring court orders.

items.title: Perth's Invasion Day rally 'explosives' scare hasn't been declared terrorism. Here's why
items.description: Identifying ideological motivations behind attacks is critical to separating terrorism from other events just designed to cause fear, an extremism expert told the ABC.

items.title: Man charged with hate speech hailed 'life-long bonds' with Neo-Nazis
items.description: Brandan Koschel had posted blurred images of himself standing next to prominent Neo-Nazis on a social media account earlier this month.

items.title: Gauff backed by ex-players after smashing racquet at Australian Open
items.description: Former world number one Andy Roddick is among those supporting Coco Gauff after footage was shown of her smashing a racquet at the Australian Open.

items.title: Health minister promises change after woman overdoses from stockpiled meds
items.description: The tragic death of a young Melbourne woman who was stockpiling medication has prompted the federal health minister to move to change the way prescriptions are recorded.

items.title: 'They're gonna die': How five people tried to stop the Challenger tragedy
items.description: Forty years ago, the Challenger space shuttle disintegrated just after lift-off. A small team of engineers tried to prevent the tragedy.

items.title: Morrison's plan to reform Islamic teaching 'worth looking at', Liberal says
items.description: Liberal frontbencher Andrew Bragg says Australian Muslims need to take some responsibility for extremist incidents and that a proposal for a register of Islamic preachers is worth considering.

items.title: Rally organiser's claim of 'bashing' by Middle Eastern men comes unstuck
items.description: March for Australia claims one of its organisers was bashed by a group of Middle Eastern men the day before Australia Day, but police and an eyewitness account have cast doubt on its claim.

items.title: Sydney's worst hotspots for microplastic pollution revealed
items.description: Microplastic pollution on Sydney's beaches and harbour shorelines has tripled in the past three years, according to a report, much of it from sources of "preventable losses".

items.title: Government turns defence sights north with $355m RAAF base upgrade
items.description: A Royal Australian Air Force base near Katherine in the NT is updated with purpose-built hangars and improved runways.

items.title: Australia's largest city is running out of landfill. It's causing a trash war
items.description: A proposal to build an incinerator in the regional town of Parkes could see 700,000 tonnes of Sydney's red bin rubbish transported there every year.

items.title: Quiz: How well do you know this year's Hottest 100 countdown?
items.description: The Hottest 100 is done for another year. Were you paying attention?

items.title: Woman accused of corruptly paying surgeons to use medical devices faces court
items.description: The finance manager is one of four people who were charged last month, following an investigation involving the Crime and Corruption Commission and the Queensland Office of the Health Ombudsman.

items.title: Hoodoo Gurus' Dave Faulkner lashes One Nation use of hit song
items.description: Faulkner says One Nation and its supporters can "take a running jump" after his band's song was used at an Australia Day rally held by the party, and he's not bothered by party supporters trolling him on social media.

items.title: Vine won Tour Down Under with broken wrist after kangaroo crash
items.description: Tour Down Under champion Jay Vine won the event with a fractured wrist suffered in a crash with kangaroos, his team reveals.

items.title: WWII and Bondi terrorist attack have similarities, daughter of victim says
items.description: Sabina Kleitman grew up knowing little about how her father survived the Holocaust as a child. Now she sees parallels between the horrors of World War II and his death at Bondi.

items.title: Historic heatwave smashes temperature records with some places nearing 50C
items.description: The Australian Open is off to a cooler start today after parts of Melbourne buckled under 45-degree heat yesterday, in a heatwave setting historic temperature records across the country's south-east.

items.title: Ground caves in at Queensland's only vaccine warehouse, causing statewide shortages
items.description: A section of floor has caved in at Queensland's only vaccine warehouse, causing statewide delays to childhood vaccination schedules.

items.title: TikTok settles as social media giants face trial over youth addiction claims
items.description: TikTok agrees to settle a landmark lawsuit on social media addiction, the same day the trial was due to start against Meta and YouTube.

items.title: Brisbane house prices forecast to rise by 20pc in two years, report finds
items.description: Brisbane's property hot run is set to continue, with house prices set to increase by almost 20 per cent over next two years, a KPMG report has found.
